snippet: The cash-and stock deal values SunGard, which provides software and technology services to financial companies, at about $9.1 billion, including debt.
abstract: Fidelity National Information Services agrees to buy rival financial services and software provider SunGard for about $9.1 billion in cash-and-stock deal; agreement is seen as modest payday for private equity consortium that purchased SunGard in 2005.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and CHAD BRAY

lead_paragraph: The cash-and stock deal values SunGard, which provides software and technology services to financial companies, at about $9.1 billion, including debt.

headline.main: Fidelity National Information Services to Buy Software Maker SunGard
headline.print_headline: SunGard, Financial Software Maker, Is Bought for $9 Billion
